description: a man in black and white looking toward the viewer's right with his PL arm over the back of a chair; red sketches of nude figures packed together form the background
portfolio: From Friends of the Artist: A Suite of Seven Etchings and Lithographs
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: Elbert Weinberg (1928–1991) was a sculptor whose work shifted from figurative studies inspired by mythology, religion and the Holocaust to abstractions combining human and plant forms. He reveled in dark humor focused on the cruel ironies of life. This portrait is part of a portfolio of seven that Barbara Swan made of artist friends who worked in New England.
title: Elbert Weinberg
